faqs.question: What is the Quick Access Panel?
faqs.answer:
The Quick Access Panel is your primary control center for Avatar Toolkit, providing essential tools and information at a glance. It consists of three main sections:

### Armature Selection
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/quick-access/QuickAccess1.png[/image]
Select and validate your armature from the dropdown menu. The panel shows validation status and bone count for the selected armature.

### Pose Controls
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/quick-access/QuickAccess2.png[/image]
Manage pose-related operations:
- Start/Stop Pose Mode
- Apply Pose as Rest Position
- Create Pose Shape Keys

### Import/Export
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/quick-access/QuickAccess3.png[/image]
Quick access to import and export functions:
- Import avatars (supports FBX format)
- Export menu with multiple format options

[note]The Quick Access Panel adapts its display based on your selected armature's validation status and current Blender mode (Object or Pose mode).[/note]

history.changes: Initial documentation of Quick Access Panel interface

faqs.question: What is the Optimization Panel?
faqs.answer:
The Optimization Panel provides essential tools for optimizing your avatar's materials and meshes. Let's explore each section:

### Materials Optimization
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/interface/interface1.png[/image]
The Materials section contains:
- **Combine Materials**: Efficiently merges similar materials to reduce draw calls

### Mesh Cleanup
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/interface/interface2.png[/image]
Tools for mesh optimization:
- **Remove Doubles**: Quick vertex merging with default settings
- **Advanced Remove Doubles**: Opens settings panel for precise vertex merging control

### Join Meshes
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/interface/interface3.png[/image]
Mesh combination tools:
- **Join All Meshes**: Combines all avatar meshes into one
- **Join Selected Meshes**: Merges only selected mesh objects

[note]All optimization tools require a valid armature to be selected in the Quick Access Panel.[/note]

history.changes: Initial documentation of Optimization Panel interface

faqs.question: What is the Tools Panel?
faqs.answer:
The Tools Panel offers a comprehensive set of utilities for avatar customization and optimization. Here's a breakdown of each section:

### General Tools
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/interface/interface4.png[/image]
Basic utilities:
- **Convert to Resonite**: Export your avatar in Resonite-compatible format

### Separation Tools
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/interface/interface5.png[/image]
Mesh separation utilities:
- **Separate by Materials**: Split mesh based on material assignments
- **Separate Loose Parts**: Split disconnected mesh components

### Bone Tools
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/interface/interface6.png[/image]
Armature manipulation:
- **Create Digitigrade**: Convert standard legs to digitigrade setup
- **Weight Tools**: Clean up weight painting and bone constraints
- **Merge Twist Bones**: Option to combine twist bone weights

### Merge Tools
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/interface/interface7.png[/image]
Bone merging options:
- **Merge to Active**: Combine selected bones into active bone
- **Merge to Parent**: Merge bones with their parents
- **Connect Bones**: Create connections between bones

### Additional Tools
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/interface/interface8.png[/image]
Extra utilities:
- **Apply Transforms**: Apply object transformations
- **Clean Shape Keys**: Remove unused shape keys

[note]Many tools require a valid armature selection and specific Blender modes (Edit, Pose, or Object mode).[/note]

history.changes: Initial documentation of Tools Panel interface

faqs.question: What is the Custom Avatar Panel?
faqs.answer:
The Custom Avatar Panel provides tools for creating and merging custom avatars. It consists of two main modes:

### Armature Mode
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/custom/custom1.png[/image]
Tools for merging armatures:
- Merge All Bones: Combines all bones from both armatures
- Apply Transforms: Applies all transformations before merging
- Join Meshes: Combines meshes after merging
- Remove Zero Weights: Cleans up weight groups
- Cleanup Shape Keys: Optimizes shape keys during merge

### Mesh Mode
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/custom/custom2.png[/image]
Tools for attaching meshes to armatures:
- Select Target Armature
- Choose Mesh to Attach
- Select Target Bone

[note]All operations require a valid armature selection to function properly.[/note]

history.changes: Initial documentation of Custom Avatar Panel interface

faqs.question: What is the Visemes Panel?
faqs.answer:
The Visemes Panel provides tools for creating and previewing visemes (mouth shapes) for your avatar. Here's what each section offers:

### Shape Key Selection
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/visemes/visemes1.png[/image]
Select the required shape keys for viseme creation:
- Mouth A Shape Key
- Mouth O Shape Key
- Mouth CH Shape Key
- Shape Intensity Slider

### Preview Controls
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/visemes/visemes2.png[/image]
Preview your viseme setup:
- Start/Stop Preview
- Preview Selection Dropdown
- Live Preview Updates

### Creation Tools
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/visemes/visemes3.png[/image]
Generate viseme shape keys with one click:
- Create Visemes Button

[note]This panel requires an active mesh with shape keys to function. If no shape keys are present, the panel will display a warning message.[/note]

history.changes: Initial documentation of Visemes Panel interface

faqs.question: What is the Eye Tracking Panel?
faqs.answer:
The Eye Tracking Panel provides comprehensive tools for setting up and testing eye tracking on your avatar. It supports both SDK2 and AV3 setups:

### SDK Version Selection
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/eyetracking/eyetracking1.png[/image]
Choose between:
- SDK2: Full eye tracking setup with blinking
- AV3: Basic eye tracking bone setup

### SDK2 Creation Mode
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/eye-tracking/eyetracking2.png[/image]
Complete setup options:
- Bone Setup (Head, Left Eye, Right Eye)
- Mesh Selection
- Shape Key Configuration (Wink, Lowerlid)
- Advanced Options (Blinking, Movement, Distance)

### SDK2 Testing Mode
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/eyetracking/eyetracking3.png[/image]
Comprehensive testing tools:
- Eye Rotation Controls (X/Y axis)
- Distance Adjustment
- Blink Testing
- Lowerlid Movement Testing

### AV3 Setup
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/eyetracking/eyetracking4.png[/image]
Simplified bone setup:
- Head Bone Selection
- Eye Bone Selection
- Quick Setup Button

[note]All eye tracking features require a valid armature with properly named bones.[/note]

history.changes: Initial documentation of Eye Tracking Panel interface

faqs.question: What is the Settings Panel?
faqs.answer:
The Settings Panel allows you to customize Avatar Toolkit's behavior and preferences:

### Language Settings
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/settings/ConfiguringAvatarToolkitSettings1.png[/image]
Choose your preferred interface language from the available options.

### Validation Settings
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/settings/ConfiguringAvatarToolkitSettings2.png[/image]
Configure armature validation rules:
- Strict Mode: Full validation
- Basic Mode: Essential checks only
- None: Disable validation

### Debug Settings
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/settings/ConfiguringAvatarToolkitSettings3.png[/image]
Developer options:
- Enable Logging: Toggle detailed operation logs

[note]Some settings changes may require a Blender restart to take effect.[/note]

history.changes: Initial documentation of Settings Panel interface

faqs.question: What is the Updater Panel?
faqs.answer:
The Updater Panel helps you keep Avatar Toolkit up to date:

### Update Check
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/updater/updater1.png[/image]
Check for and install new versions:
- Check for Updates button
- Update to Latest Version option

### Version Selection
[image:800:400]https://cdn.neoneko.xyz/avatartoolkit/wiki/updater/updater2.png[/image]
Manage versions:
- Select specific versions
- View current version
- Install selected version

[info]Avatar Toolkit automatically checks for updates daily when enabled.[/info]

[note]Blender restart is required after updates to apply changes.[/note]

history.changes: Initial documentation of Updater Panel interface
